definition: root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The differential diagnosis of sciatica of nerve roots and nerve trunk.
sentences.chinese: 根性及干性坐骨神经痛的鉴别。

sentences.english: On Liu Shaoqi s Inheriting and Criticism to Chinas Traditional Culture;
sentences.chinese: 继承传统文化的同时应批判国民劣根性。

sentences.english: Oak is a sun-loving plant and has deep roots, which can bear strong wind.
sentences.chinese: 麻栎是喜光树种，深根性，抗风能力强。

sentences.english: Traditional beliefs are, it seems, tough to shift.
sentences.chinese: 出于传统的劣根性，似乎很难改变。

sentences.english: Anyway, a drink highBad quality have been brought out.
sentences.chinese: 反正一喝高，劣根性纷纷出笼。

sentences.english: Evil people is that after the loss of precious sleep.
sentences.chinese: 人的劣根性在于，失去后才觉出珍贵。

sentences.english: By contraries, loess soil possessing of deep soil layer, suits for taproot tree.
sentences.chinese: 而黄绵土土层深厚，更适宜直根性树木生长发育。

sentences.english: They affected the formation of fundamental character of master and servant in the Chinese national character.
sentences.chinese: 这影响了中国国民性中主奴根性的形成。

sentences.english: Robinia Pseudoacacia is a deep root tree.
sentences.chinese: 刺槐在遗传特性上表现为深根性树种。

sentences.english: And they are delight to be mentioned again. This is the bad quality of the artists.
sentences.chinese: 而他们又意被重提，这是艺术家的劣根性。

sentences.english: His deep-rooted bad habits are simply beyond remedy.
sentences.chinese: 他的劣根性简直不可救药。

definition: Hinayana, the Lesser Vehicle/Buddhism in India before the Mayahana sutras/also pr. [Xiao3 cheng2]
the innermost depths of one's heart/(Buddhism) manas (the mind)
variant of 思維|思维[si1 wei2]
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
see 唯識宗|唯识宗[Wei2 shi2 zong1]
